videos.title: UCI Gravel Suisse 2025 (Full Ride Uncut)
videos.description:
🌍 UCI Gravel Suisse 2025 – Full Ride (Uncut) | The Summit 🇨🇭

This is the UCI Gravel World Series “The Summit” at Gravel Suisse. You’re watching the complete, uncut ride from Aigle’s World Cycling Center up to Col de la Croix and down to Villars—complete with live GPX data, power metrics, heart rate, and every personal moment.

📍 Route:
Aigle (World Cycling Center) → Plambuit 4×4 gravel track → Ollon descent → Antagnes & Gryonne canal → Rhône valley climb to Lavey-les-Bains → forest tracks above Bex → Solalex & Frience rolling gravel → Taveyanne singletrack → Ensex singletrack → Col de Bretaye summit (1 778 m) → forest descent to Col de la Croix road → final gravel drag to Col de la Croix → 7 km swoop down to Villars

📅 Date: June 28, 2025
📏 Distance: 98 km
⛰️ Elevation Gain: 3 300 m
⚡ Includes: Power, heart rate, GPS tracking
🔗 Strava ride: https://www.strava.com/activities/14941621804

🎬 What happened during the ride:

Pre-race mishap: while pulling on my sock before the start, I tweaked my shoulder/back—had to brace myself from the gun.

Strong start: despite the pre-race twinge, I powered away from Aigle into the first gravel switchbacks.

Tire hindsight: I ran Thunder Burt 2.1″ tires, which proved overkill on these firm gravel and mixed surfaces.

Race → Tour: about 1 – 1.5 hours in, I dialed back the effort—scenery over watts.

Mid-ride grind: through Bex woods up to Solalex & Frience—steep pitches rewarded with panoramic views.

Taveyanne to Bretaye: technical singletrack gems, then a gravel haul to the 1 778 m summit.

Final push: forest descent, then the last gravel drag to Col de la Croix—painful but oh-so-rewarding.

🎞️ Highlights edit coming soon—stay tuned for the cinematic cut!

📺 Unlocked by Tim
I ride to explore, to push, to connect.
What the road reveals, the ride teaches.

Drop a comment if you’ve ever flipped from race mode into tour mode! 😅

#UCIGravelWorldSeries #FullRide #UnlockedByTim #GravelSuisse #UCIGravelSuisse  #TheSummit #AlpineGravel #GPXData #AigleToVillars

videos.title: Ep 2/3 UCI SUISSE - HOW TO QUALIFY FOR GRAVEL WORLD CHAMPIONSHIP - THE SUMMIT GRAVEL - 100KM / 3500M
videos.description:
Episode 2 of 3 in a weekend packed full of climbing in Villars, Switzerland. 

Saturday morning I rolled out from Villars at 6am for a 7.30am start from the UCI Cycling Centre in Aigle. From the valley floor we climbed to the summit of Villars, on the Col du la Croix. 

As mentioned in my previous video I didn’t have the intention to race, but I still wanted to ride ‘smart’ and save energy where possible. This worked well on the brief flatter sections on the valley floor. 

Thanks to Velo Edge, and Matt in particular for helping me with the bike build of my Enve Mog. Not known as a climbing bike, but watch this video and then decide :)

On Instagram: le.pointdevue

Watch out for episode 3 where I attempt to qualify on the road!

videos.title: Downhill Mountain Bike near Aigle, Switzerland
videos.description:
Test GoPro 7 Hypersmooth mode (but wrong recording settings this time) - 720p
Filmed in the woods near Aigle, Switzerland

videos.title: Aigle-Martigny 2020 - Home of cycling
videos.description: Le saviez-vous? Les Championnats du Monde Route UCI 2020 se dérouleront du 20 au 27 septembre à Aigle et Martigny! Les meilleurs cyclistes du monde s'affronteront alors au cœur des Alpes. Un évènement à ne pas manquer.

videos.title: Jura MTB | St Ursanne to Saignelégier | reto outdoor
videos.description:
This video summaries the fourth of nine stages of the Jura bike route, which takes riders from Basel to Lake Geneva. Each stage covers around 35km with app 1000 meters total climbing. Mostly gravel bike territory, the occasional single trail and quite a lot on the road...

details: https://www.schweizmobil.ch/de/mountainbikeland/route-03.html

#Switzerland #MTB #JURA #JURABIKE #saignelegier #franchesmontagnes #StUrsanne #bikeride #mountainbiking

RATING of stage three: 

1. nature/landscape/sights: 4/5

2. trails: 2/5 (too much road cycling, too much cow shit, the single trail stretch would be nice if it were DOWNhill...)
